nodes.text: You can, but there is little point. Should I feel compassion for a man forced to watch horrible images if he is blind? I can, but there is little point.  He? Who says I am male? What is in the womb is not an 'infant' (your overly emotional non-argument nonwithstanding). I do have compassion... for the woman.  'outraged that the human race allows it to continue'? No, not really. I understand what motivates people. There are certain things that I feel are disgusting and would stop if I were able to. I don't think there is one thing I am passionate about over all else, but this issue does rank above many others. I feel disgusted that there are those who would make women second class citizens.

I know of no one that wants to make women a second class cititzen.......I know I sure don't............I just want and infant in the womb to have the same chance at life that you and I had......... It is my hope that before I die that I see the barbaric act of legaling killing babies in the womb, Rowe V Wade overturned and give the decision on abortion back to individual state so that all these beautiful babies. gifts from God hve a chance at life...........
In the first trimester there is no consciousness and no possibility of pain. This method is safe for the woman.
So we should only feel compassion if there is pain?

It is my hope that before I die that I see the barbaric act of legaling killing babies in the womb, Rowe V Wade overturned and give the decision on abortion back to individual state so that all these beautiful babies. gifts from God hve a chance at life...........
And I will fight on it until you can open your eyes to the needs of living and view women as real live people, too.
And if the state decides to keep abortion legal? Then you don't care if these 'gifts from God' have a chance or not?
